name: Gohan
description: A bowl of plain steamed white (hakumai) or brown (genmai) rice.

name: Natto Rice
description: Fermented soybean served over steamed white (hakumai) or brown (genmai) rice, seasoned with soy sauce.
options: Options: Katsubushi (dried bonito shavings), chopped green onions, karashi (spicy mustard), kizaminori (sliced dried and seasoned seaweed)

name: Okayu
description: Rice gruel served with toasted white sesame seeds, Japanese salted salmon, mitsuba (Japanese parsley), kizami nori (shredded nori seaweed) and umeboshi (Japanese pickled plums)

name: Tamago Kake Gohan
description: Protein and carbohydrate rich bowl of rice topped with raw egg and soy seasoning.

name: Yakizakana
description: Traditional salted and seared fish ([Aji] Dried horse mackerel or salmon)

name: Tsukemono
description: An assortment of pickled vegetables served as a side dish gently complimenting a bowl of Gohan (rice).
options: Options: Daikon (Japanese Radish), cucumber, eggplant, cabbage, water lily root, umeboshi (plum), carrot and shallots.

name: Miso Shiru
description: Fermented soybean paste (miso) in dashi broth. Tofu, chopped green onion, wakame seaweed, Japanese mushrooms, and a seasonal ingredient (ask waiter)

name: Chilli Prawn Ramen
description: Ramen noodles, beans and chilli marinated prawns served in a spicy vegetable broth. Topped with chopped green onions and lime.

name: Chicken Ramen
description: Ramen noodles in chicken soup garnished with spring onions, coriander, lime, and grilled chicken

name: Grilled Duck Ramen
description: Noodles in vegetable broth topped with red onion, green onion, coriander and pan-seared duck breast

name: Seafood Soup
description: Vegetable broth with mixed seafood, topped with Japanese sake

name: Dumpling Soup
description: Traditional Japanese dumplings filled with beef and chives served in a chicken stock , topped with green chopped onions.

name: Ebi Fried
description: Large breaded fried shrimp served with a bowl of hakumai/genmai rice and lemon.

name: Grilled mixed vegetables
description: Grilled carrot, aubergine, spring onion, mushroom and sweet potato topped with butter and Japanese soya sauce.

name: Japanese BBQ Spareribs
description: BBQ pork spareribs grilled in Japanese style, marinated in Japanese BBQ sauce. Served with mixed vegetables and apple honey sauce.

name: Tofu Steak with Mushrooms
description: Tempura fried tofu marinated in soy sauce, maple syrup, sesame oil and rice vinegar. Topped with shiitake mushrooms and mushroom sauce.

name: Tiger Roll
description: Avocado, shrimp, tempura, cucumber, tobiko

name: Philadelphia Roll
description: Salmon, avocado, cream cheese

name: Crunch Roll
description: Spicy tuna, crispy seaweed, tempura

name: Dynamite Roll
description: Shrimp, tempura, yellowtail, bean sprouts, carrots, avocado, cucumber, chilli, spicy mayo.

name: Dragon Roll
description: Eel, crab, cucumber, avocado, eel sauce

name: California Roll
description: Crab, avocado, cucumber, sesame seeds

name: Spicy Tuna Roll
description: Tuna, mayo, chilli sauce

name: Vegetable Roll
description: Cucumber, fresh carrot, scallion, avocado, asparagus, cream cheese

name: Tempura Roll
description: Tempura prawn, sesame seeds, cucumber

category: Sashimi (served with mixed leaves and ginger)
name: Ahi
description: raw tuna

category: Sashimi (served with mixed leaves and ginger)
name: Aji
description: Spanish mackerel

category: Sashimi (served with mixed leaves and ginger)
name: Amaebi
description: Sweet shrimp

category: Sashimi (served with mixed leaves and ginger)
name: Bincho
description: Albacore white tuna

category: Sashimi (served with mixed leaves and ginger)
name: Kani
description: Cooked crab meat

category: Sashimi (served with mixed leaves and ginger)
name: Saba
description: Raw mackerel

name: Banana Sushi
description: Japanese-inspired dessert combining chocolate dipped bananas with crushed pistachios.

name: Wagashi (served with green tea)
description: Traditional Japanese sweet served with a hot cup of green tea. Made of sweet azuki bean paste (anko), rice cakes (mochi), Japanese agar (kanten) or sesame paste.

name: Namagashi
description: Rice flour and anko filling, delicately shaped by hand to represent each season of the year.

name: Daifuku
description: A small ball of anko wrapped in mochi (soft rice cake). Covered with a dusting of potato starch.
options: Options: Strawberry, sweet beans, ice cream.

name: Dango
description: Steamed rice flour dumplings served skewered and topped with anko.

name: Green Tea Cookies
description: Macha flavoured, green tea cookies loaded with white chocolate chips.
